importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The crash occurred in September 2025, marking a critical incident that triggered investigations into safety protocols, maintenance practices, and certification standards in Portugal’s public transport infrastructure.

keyTakeAways: A steel cable in the Glória funicular in Lisbon failed to meet the operator's specifications and was not certified to carry passengers, leading to a deadly crash.
The cable snapped shortly after the funicular cars began their journey on Calçada da Glória, causing one car to derail and crash into a building.
Eyewitnesses described the event as chaotic and terrifying, with one man, Bruno, recalling the car appearing 'out of control' and a loud bang followed by a cloud of brown smoke.
The Office for the Prevention and Investigation of Accidents in Civil Aviation and Rail (GPIAAF) identified serious failures in the cable, maintenance, and braking systems.
Maintenance tasks were marked as completed without actual performance, and the maintenance plan was falsely recorded as 'compliant and accepted' by the operator.
The preliminary report is not conclusive, and a final report is expected to be released next year.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A fatal crash on the Glória funicular in Lisbon, Portugal, in September 2025, resulted in at least 16 deaths and multiple injuries when a steel cable snapped during operation on Calçada da Glória. Preliminary findings from the Office for the Prevention and Investigation of Accidents in Civil Aviation and Rail (GPIAAF) reveal that the cable failed to meet safety specifications set by operator CARRIS, and that maintenance records were falsified, with tasks marked as completed without actual execution. Eyewitnesses described the crash as chaotic and terrifying, with one man named Bruno recounting the car appearing out of control. The report notes serious failures in cable integrity, maintenance, and braking systems, and while the findings are preliminary, they raise urgent concerns about safety compliance and oversight in public transport operations in Portugal.
title: Cable in deadly Portugal funicular crash failed to meet specifications, preliminary report finds
